snippet: Before Eugenio German’s wife died of cancer, she petitioned to make him eligible for citizenship so that he could secure a future for himself and their three children.
abstract: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of New York, one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, gives Eugenio German $800 to pay for his citizenship application.
lead_paragraph: Before Eugenio German’s wife died of cancer, she petitioned to make him eligible for citizenship so that he could secure a future for himself and their three children.

headline.print_headline:
Deceased Wife’s Foresight
Helps Man Make Progress
